message.entry: 'xyzPoints' value must be of size M-by-3 or M-by-N-by-3.
{0} requires at least 1 valid point in the input pointCloud.
'X', 'Y' and 'Z' must be of the same size.
'C' must be a single color or its dimensions must correspond to the number of input points.
'Color' must be a single color or a single RGB triplet of size 1-by-3 or its dimensions must correspond to the number of input points.
'Normal' must correspond to the number of input points.
Incorrect size of intensity input. Each intensity value must correspond to an input point.
'RangeData' must correspond to the number of input points.
'depthDevice' must be a valid videoinput or imaq.VideoDevice object configured for Kinect for Windows.
Depth image and color image resolutions must be the same.
Internal organized point cloud search error.
Internal organized point cloud search error: {0}.
Input is not a valid rigid transformation.
Input grid step is too small.
Input point cloud must be organized (M-by-N-by-3).
'point' value must be a row vector of size 1-by-3.
Input ROI is invalid. Specify the ROI as a vector of form [xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax, zmin, zmax].
Input point clouds must have at least 3 unique valid points to determine a 3-D transformation.
{0} does not support an array of pointClouds.
Selected codegen target is not supported. Only MATLAB Host targets are supported for pointCloud code generation.
Approximate search is not supported in code generation for non-host targets. 'MaxLeafChecks' value is set to 'Inf'.
Spatial limits must be increasing in the X, Y and Z directions.
BinOutput must be a compile time constant.
This object only supports one-dimensional indexing.
The location property of all point clouds must have the same dimensionality.
All objects must belong to the same class.
Selected indices out of range. Indices must be between one and number of points in pointCloud.
Row/column indices specified are out of range. The row/column indices must be between one and upper bounds of the rows/columns of the organized point cloud.
Intensity must be one of these types: uint8, uint16, single, double.
Invalid color value. Expected color values of type single or double to be between 0 and 1.
Internal file parsing error. Please see the documentation for more details.
Not all points defined in the header could be loaded.
File name must be a character vector.
File extension is not supported. File extension must be PLY or PCD.
pcwrite does not support point clouds with colors of uint16 datatype for writing in PCD files.
Unable to open the specified file.
Unsupported file version. Please see the documentation for supported versions.
The file encoding format is not supported.
Error in writing the header to the file.
Error in writing the data to the file.
Invalid input file. Header of input PLY or PCD file must be in ASCII format with the COUNT entry set to 1.
Error in reading the data from the file.
Cannot find the required properties in the file.
'painters' renderer is not recommended for rendering point cloud data. Use 'opengl' instead.
The point cloud does not have enough valid points.
The plane is outside the axis limits.
Input argument {0} must be a pointCloud object.
The input point cloud does not contain any intensity values.
The input point cloud does not contain any color values.
The input point cloud must be an organized point cloud to use {0} argument name.
Set X-axis as vertical axis and direction pointing up
Set X-axis as vertical axis and direction pointing down
Set Y-axis as vertical axis and direction pointing up
Set Y-axis as vertical axis and direction pointing down
Set Z-axis as vertical axis and direction pointing up
Set Z-axis as vertical axis and direction pointing down
Solver stopped because the change of the pose was less than the specified tolerance value.
Unable to find valid voxels in the fixed point cloud.

Gradient of the objective function at initialization is zero. This could be due to: \n - a bad initial transformation. Consider using a different initial transformation. \n - a bad voxel grid step. Consider using a different grid step.
Solver stopped because the magnitude of the gradient of the objective function was less than the specified tolerance.
Solver stopped because the change of the input variables was less than the specified tolerance.
Solver stopped because the number of iterations reached the specified maximum value.
Solver stopped because the change of the objective function value was less than the specified tolerance value.
Solver stopped because the solution evaluation function provided by the user returns false.
Change in translation: {0}. Change in rotation: {1}. Inlier root mean square error: {2}
Unable to register the point clouds. Consider providing a better initial transformation using InitialTransform name-value argument.
Incorrect combination of name-value arguments specified.\nSpecify only the InlierRatio or InlierDistance name-value argument to exclude outliers.
At least three pairs of matching points are needed to find the transformation.\nConsider increasing the InlierDistance value.
At least three pairs of matching points are needed to find the transformation.\nConsider increasing the InlierRatio value.
Input point clouds must contain non-empty color values to register using ''{0}'' metric.
Unable to initialize the target point cloud with color properties.
C/C++ code generation is not supported when the Metric value is "pointToPlaneWithColor" or "planeToPlaneWithColor".

The Extrapolate name-value argument is not supported. You can increase the MaxIterations argument or use the "pointToPlane" or "planeToPlane" values for the Metric name-value argument to get similar accuracy.
pcregrigid is not supported. Use pcregistericp instead to register point clouds using the ICP algorithm.
At least two points are needed to determine transformation.
Current estimated percentage change in log likelihood function value : {0}
Iterations stopped. The solution didn't converge due to ill conditioned or non finite matrix computation.
Parameter ''{0}'' is ignored when 'Transform' is not 'Nonrigid'.
The value of {0} must be constant for code generation.
MaxLeafChecks option is not considered for GPU Code Generation.
camMatrix option is not considered for GPU Code Generation.
GPU code generation for variable input sizes is not optimized. Consider using constant size inputs for an optimized code generation.
For GPU code generation, number of neighbors K, must be a compile time constant. Generating CPU (C/C++) code instead.
GPU code generation for 'multiQueryRadiusSearchImpl' is not optimized. Generating CPU (C/C++) code instead.
Setting the NumClusterPoints, Method and ParallelNeighborSearch name-value arguments is not supported for GPU code generation.
PreserveStructure is not supported for GPU code generation.
findPointsInCylinder is not supported for GPU code generation.
GPU code generation is not supported for the Metric value "pointToPlaneWithColor" or "planeToPlaneWithColor".
Expected all point clouds in ptClouds to have attributes (Location, Intensity) of the same type.
Code generation is not supported for the 'nearest' grid filter.
GPU code generation is not supported for the 'gridNearest' downsampling method.
GPU code generation is not supported for the 'nearest' grid filter.
The NumClusterPoints values must be integers or Inf.
Code generation is not supported for the exhaustive method.
Setting ParallelNeighborSearch to true for the exhaustive method has no effect. Consider setting it to false.
The map has no valid voxels.
The selected submap has no valid voxels.

CUDA code generation does not support changing the value for the 'Confidence' parameter to find the maximum number of inliers. Using the default confidence value of 99 for optimized CUDA code generation.
The loop closure detector has no descriptors.
The number of rows in the input point cloud must be greater than one.
Intrinsics object must have a FocalLength field.
Intrinsics object must have a PrincipalPoint field.
Set this to make points appear bigger when you zoom in. To enable this, select first person navigation control in Camera section
To set this property, select first person navigation control in Camera section
There is a known rendering performance problem with pcviewer and Lidar Viewer app on this platform, for more information click here
There is a known rendering performance problem with point cloud visualization on this platform, for more information click here
Point cloud contains over 10 million points. To ensure smooth interactions, the viewer is generating an optimized octree structure.
Specifying input color is not supported for LAZ files optimized for visualization.

An octree LAZ file has been generated to optimize visualization performance. This file allows you to visualize the point cloud in the future without the need for regeneration. Would you like to export this file?
